activities.loc: Branch I, Courthouse Annex, Second Floor

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kimberly Diane Schroeder

records.addlTxt: Atty Mackenzie Christensen appointed as dean atty for Deft - repayment by Deft of $50 per mth comm 12-1-22

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Letter from JA to Deft re: dean atty

09:15 AM Defendant Kimberly Diane Schroeder in court.  Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deft heard - not eligible for PD, request Dean atty, provides form.
Court reviews form w/Deft.
Court grants requests and shall appoint dean atty w/repayment by Deft of $50 per mth comm 12-1-22.
Court schedules w/parties.
9:16 am
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:23 AM Defendant Kimberly Diane Schroeder appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jon Spansail appeared by video with Defendant.  Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Copy of comp.
Court heard on charges and penalties.
DA heard on bail and priors.
Atty Spansail heard on bail.
Court sets $3,000 cash w/conditions: sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid RX, no contact with known drug users or dealers.
Atty Spansail heard - still needs to complete evaluation and conflict check.
Court schedules.
10:30 am
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
